dublinCore.dc:title: 113 SRES 505 IS: Congratulating the Gay, Lesbian, and Allies Senate Staff (GLASS) Caucus association on the 10-year anniversary of the association.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Baldwin (for herself, Mr. Udall of New Mexico, Mrs. Murray, Mr. Brown, Ms. Mikulski, Mr. Durbin, Mrs. Boxer, Mr. Udall of Colorado, Mr. Heinrich, Mr. Levin, Mr. Markey, Ms. Warren, Mr. Sanders, Mrs. Shaheen, Ms. Hirono, and Mr. Bennet) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration

form.official-title: Congratulating the Gay, Lesbian, and Allies Senate Staff (GLASS) Caucus association on the 10-year anniversary of the association.

whereas.text: Whereas the GLASS Caucus association continues to promote the welfare and dignity of LGBT Senate employees; and
Whereas the GLASS Caucus association continues to provide a safe environment for social interaction and professional development: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: congratulates the Gay, Lesbian, and Allies Senate Staff Caucus association (referred to in this resolution as the GLASS Caucus association) on the momentous occasion of the association's 10th anniversary;
commends the late Senator Frank Raleigh Lautenberg of New Jersey for the critical role he played in the formation of the GLASS Caucus association and for his stalwart support for equality; and

recognizes inaugural GLASS Caucus Steering Committee members Lynden Armstrong, Brett Bearce, Jeffrey Levensaler, Josh Brekenfeld, Jason Knapp, John Fossum, Kelsey Phipps, and Mat Young for their vision and hard work in establishing the GLASS Caucus association.
